basics.name: Arzucan Özgür
basics.label: Associate Professor
basics.location: Department of Computer Engineering, Bogazici University, 34342 Bebek, Istanbul, Turkey
basics.bio: I am a faculty member in the [Department of Computer Engineering](http://www.cmpe.boun.edu.tr/) at [Bogazici University](http://www.boun.edu.tr/), and co-director of [TABI (Text Analytics and Bioinformatics) Lab](http://tabilab.cmpe.boun.edu.tr/). I'm also a member of the [AILAB](http://ailab.cmpe.boun.edu.tr/). My research is at the intersection of **bioinformatics** and **natural language processing** with the goal of developing algorithms for processing and understanding both natural (human) languages and the languages encoded in biological molecular sequences.
basics.short_bio: I joined the Department of Computer Engineering at Bogazici University in 2011. Prior to that I worked in the Faculty of Computer and Informatics at Istanbul Technical University between 2010-2011. I received my **Ph.D. degree in Computer Science and Engineering** from the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, USA in 2010. I hold an M.S. degree and a B.S. degree in Computer Engineering from Bogazici University.

news.text: Gokce Uludogan presented "Exploiting Pretrained Biochemical Language Models for Targeted Drug Design" at **ECCB 2022** in Barcelona, Spain. The paper is published in the *Bioinformatics* journal.
Arzucan Ozgur serves in the Organizing Committee of **RECOMB 2023**, which took place in Istanbul between 14-19 April 2023.
Arzucan Ozgur serves as Vice Chair for the IAPR Technical Committee on **Pattern Recognition for Bioinformatics and Digital Health** between 2022-2024.

New paper co-authored by Merve Unlu Menevse, Yusufcan Manav, Ebru Arisoy, and Arzucan Ozgur entitled "A Framework for Automatic Generation of Spoken Question-Answering Data" is accepted to the **Findings of EMNLP 2022**.
Saziye Betul Ozates successfully defended her PhD thesis entitled "Deep Learning-based Dependency Parsing for Turkish".

projects.title: Utilizing Digital Technology for Social Cohesion
projects.summary: Utilizing Digital Technology for Social Cohesion, Positive Messaging and Peace by Boosting Collaboration, Exchange and Solidarity. The project is led by the Hrant Dink Foundation (HDV) and is a collaboration between HDV, Sabanci University, and Bogazici University.

projects.title: Chemical Language Processing for Target-based Drug Design
projects.summary: Developing chemical language processing methods for target-based drug design using deep learning approaches.

projects.title: A Deep Learning based Turkish Dependency Parser
projects.summary: Developing a deep learning based dependency parser for Turkish language.

projects.title: Contextual Text Mining from the Biomedical Scientific Literature
projects.summary: Developing text mining techniques to automatically extract biologically important information such as relationships between biomolecules from scientific publications.
projects.funder: European Commission, FP7 Marie Curie Career Integration Grant
